newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Mastroianni dies - Italy agency.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Mastroianni dies - Italy agency.

text.p: Italian film actor Marcello Mastroianni died on Thursday in Paris, the Italian news agency ANSA reported. He was 72.
ANSA, which said the actor had been ill, gave no other details. Another Italian news agency, AGI, said the film star died at his house in Paris and had been suffering from cancer of the pancreas.
Mastroianni, one of Europe's enduring screen symbols of the Latin Lover, was Italy's most internationally recognised actor.

From his first worldwide success in director Federico Fellini's "La Dolce Vita" in 1960 to his portrayal of the ageing dancer in Fellini's "Ginger and Fred" a quarter of a century later, Mastroianni was the Italian cinema's leading male export.

Apart from "La Dolce Vita", Mastroianni will perhaps be best remembered for films in which he starred with Sophia Loren such as "Marriage Italian Style", "The Priest's Wife", "Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow", "Sunflowers" and "A Special Day."
